ideaContests.description:
In the first test phase of the project, 'Transparent Conductive Oxides', (TCO) was selected
 as the technology, which was developed by the Leibniz Institute for New Materials (INM). TCO are conductive
 and flexible materials which are used in the form of thin coatings in various areas (e.g. foils or
 displays).
ideaContests.title: Transparent Conductive Oxides (TCO)

ideaContests.description:
The second idea contest within the Ideas-to-Market Project. The Fraunhofer FHR, which
 provided a new radar technology (called Bionic Radar) that uses machine learning to uniquely detect movement
 patterns via radar, working even in bad weather.
ideaContests.title: Bionic Radar

ideaContests.description:
This project was done in the context of research on the interactive concept validation. We asked
 Amazon Mechanical Turk workers to brainstorm ideas for features for a mobile app to Mechanical Turk. Within this contest,
 we tested three conditions: No micro-tasks for inspirations, A rating microtask for inspiration, and a concept validation
 micro-task on submission of ideas.
ideaContests.title: Features for an mturk mobile app

ideaContests.description:
This project was done in the context of research on fully-automatic idea similarity measures. Participants
 brainstormed on ideas on how to improve the environment, using our crowdsourced-brainstorming tool.
ideaContests.title: How to improve the environment?
